author: potuz
content:
<@!449019668296892420> now that you are around perhaps you can clarify a confusion I have about serialization of a container with mixed, fixed sized parts and variable sized parts. At this point in the SSZ spec we need to serialize a sum of lengths:
```
# Interleave offsets of variable-size parts with fixed-size parts
variable_offsets = [serialize(sum(fixed_lengths + variable_lengths[:i])) for i in range(len(value))]
```
Now those numbers (the results of the sums) are to be considered as `uintN` where `N`  is the minimal number in `[8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256]` such that the number fits or is it serialized as a uint with fixed `N` ?

author: arnetheduck
content: which spec version did you pull that comment from? offsets are generally 4 bytes - see https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/ssz/simple-serialize.md#constants and https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/ssz/simple-serialize.md#vectors-containers-lists
